item.title: 105/L42 – Pinot
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Pinot Christ the man wanders the wine aisle, lingering amidst pinots’ dark tannins and depth of dusky grapes, crushed. Just a small dinner among friends. He waves off the steward’s suggestion of bargain bottles. He’ll gladly pay. Yet finds he … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Pinot

Christ the man wanders
the wine aisle, lingering
amidst pinots’ dark
tannins and depth
of dusky grapes, crushed.
Just a small dinner
among friends. He waves off
the steward’s suggestion
of bargain bottles.
He’ll gladly pay. Yet
finds he doesn’t
want to choose.
The hour grows late.
The party has begun.
The loaf, fresh
in his hand, still warm,
is slowly going cold.

item.title: 104/L41 – Fig
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Fig Christ the man curses down the fig tree. Dead limbs drop rotten fruit on his side of the fence. Black flies and bees descend in swarm. The hungry mob sounds a thousand, five thousand strong. A crawling mass, a … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Fig

Christ the man curses
down the fig tree. Dead
limbs drop rotten fruit
on his side of the fence.
Black flies and bees descend
in swarm. The hungry mob
sounds a thousand, five thousand
strong. A crawling mass,
a creeping skin of mouths
consumes the putrid body,
dumped as if in haste in long weeds
and wildflowers. What sweetness
lingers he knows as loss.

item.title: 103/L40 – Palm
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Palm Christ the man suffers peroxide in the ugly cut. Pruning saw bucked sudden, caught laurel’s tough edge, tore his palm. Bloodied leaves trace a hurried path, wreath his disheveled head. Hiss and cleansing sting rush out. The pulse shuddering … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Palm

Christ the man suffers
peroxide in the ugly cut.
Pruning saw bucked
sudden, caught laurel’s
tough edge, tore his palm.
Bloodied leaves trace
a hurried path, wreath
his disheveled head.
Hiss and cleansing sting
rush out. The pulse
shuddering his wrist
fascinates–echo
of his truest self
bleeding into
sink’s stark bowl,
mingling brightened red
and dirtied white, pooling
a moment in the bell
before submitting
to drain’s dark pull.

item.title: 102/L39 – Gamble
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Gamble Christ the man gambles the last of his nights away on cards he cares little for. It’s the men at table, the feel of money slipping or piling on a bluff, a whim he deals in for. The turn, … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Gamble

Christ the man gambles
the last of his nights away
on cards he cares little for.
It’s the men at table,
the feel of money
slipping or piling
on a bluff, a whim
he deals in for. The turn,
the draw, the river coming
in his favor or hard against.
He bides his time, lying low
at the table, telling nothing
while his brothers spout
and coerce, badger, live
as if it meant nothing.
The drink and smoke.
The long dark hours.
He cherishes it all,
going all in at last
near the break of day.
The final flop comes
to tired eyes. A single card.
He folds without a word,
that last guarded hand
a final testament.

item.title: 101/L38 – Hip
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Hip Christ the man salves the coroded hip joint out of true for ages. Peter bites his lip, holds him steady in his anguish. The rock their fists make: one sunken in the tomb of the unforgiving tub, the other … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Hip

Christ the man salves
the coroded hip joint
out of true for ages.
Peter bites his lip,
holds him steady
in his anguish. The rock
their fists make: one
sunken in the tomb
of the unforgiving tub,
the other a ladder
to cling to. Their eyes
bind a tether. He cries out
at the end of his rope,
shrouded in the sound
of his own dying voice.

item.title: 100/L37 – Ebenezer
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Ebenezer Christ the man says aloud the places he’ll leave behind: Kings Hill, Goose Hollow, Buckman, Old Town, Irvington, Skidmore. A list made map incarnate. Each name distinct, each name an Ebenezer carved from the heart’s quarry, his body ringing … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Ebenezer

Christ the man says aloud
the places he’ll leave behind:
Kings Hill, Goose Hollow,
Buckman, Old Town, Irvington,
Skidmore. A list made map
incarnate. Each name
distinct, each name
an Ebenezer carved
from the heart’s quarry,
his body ringing
with the work of shearing
and shaping. Each name
a weight that keeps him
close to earth and water
a little longer.

item.title: 99/L36 – Blessing
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Blessing Christ the man counts each drawn breath a blessing. An ER rerun is on TV in the other half of the curtained room. The man lying there behind the veil won’t lie there for long. His young charge sleeps … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Blessing

Christ the man counts
each drawn breath
a blessing. An ER
rerun is on TV
in the other half
of the curtained room.
The man lying there
behind the veil
won’t lie there for long.
His young charge sleeps on
despite the ruckus.
Blood cleanses itself,
lungs take air, release,
take air again. Peace.
A woman yells, alarms sound,
and for one hectic moment
the two rooms mingle. Between
worlds. Which is the real?
Christ the man bows his head
to count each breath, blessing.

item.title: 98/L35 – Gin
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Gin Christ the man shakes hands in common greeting and farewell. Exhausted from the effort he retires to porch swing and gin, to afternoon of silent remembrance. Violets and rosemary along the walk. Names and faces of the many, the … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Gin

Christ the man shakes
hands in common greeting
and farewell. Exhausted
from the effort he retires
to porch swing and gin,
to afternoon of silent
remembrance. Violets
and rosemary along the walk.
Names and faces of the many,
the particular shape
of each hand in his–like wax
he holds the imprint.
His creased palms the same
as theirs, singing silent
psalms of fear and shield,
of hope and forgive. Gin
-warm he sings low under
his heated breath, sings
down the afternoon, his hands
clasped in thanksgiving.

item.title: 97/L34 – Barbecue
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Barbecue Christ the man salsas barefoot across the lawn, a soft but rigid frame for Yvonne to ply against. In rhythm they quarter turn and turn again. Their laughter turns heads of neighbors mingling in mild conversation about promotions, vacation … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Barbecue

Christ the man salsas
barefoot across the lawn,
a soft but rigid frame
for Yvonne to ply against.
In rhythm they quarter
turn and turn again.
Their laughter turns heads
of neighbors mingling
in mild conversation
about promotions, vacation
plans, yard work woes,
homeowners’ dues.
Children join in but
are quickly pulled aside.
They smile wide and
put more hip into it.
Her blackened curls, flagrant
as her reputation, shimmy
in time. They mar the grass
with Latin flair; rutted proof
of their abandon. The music fades
to forced static. She leans in
to kiss his cheek in gratitude.
He lets it linger, savoring the holy
press in her lips.

item.title: 96/L33 – Station
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Station Christ the man cracks pistachios in the bar car. Split shells fill an ashtray, spill out, run over. The Sound slips by, Tacoma, Tukwila, southbound circuit. He will return to rain and obscurity. To work the same ground over … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Station

Christ the man cracks
pistachios in the bar car.
Split shells fill an ashtray,
spill out, run over.
The Sound slips by,
Tacoma, Tukwila,
southbound circuit.
He will return to rain
and obscurity. To work
the same ground over
and again. No love
in his native land.
He dozes, head in hand,
dreams of Florida,
of warm beaches,
of palms. A different track
were only possible. Wakes
to the conductor warning
five minutes, all doors,
all passengers, five minutes
to station, end of the line.
